Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mrmarino
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived it was not good. They lost my reservation. English, was broken , at best at reception and belhops only speak Spanish, and a re slow and uncaring, this for a businees hotel. No wifi in rooms. Had to call to get, pen, paper, and a glasses. and articles for the bathroom. Bathroom sink had no popper to close drain. Drying yourself with the towels was like using sandpaper. Mattress was very hard, which I like, most don't but pillows werenlike slabs of cement. Mine ended up on the floor. Nothing in the area as it's an industrial area but heavy traffic & w/street vendors. Ta200 pesos to airport, 350/400 from hotel).xi's expensive at hotel , go out of hotel , turn R and go a block or two and much cheaper ( There is a business center but didn't use it, nor do I know the charges, and there are charges. Restaurant in the basement w/large windows w/people walking by can stare down at you as well as a staircase can come sdown to eat. More like a cafeteria. The food was just oh, expcept for Salmon I had once, but the foof was never hot. I will never go back here, unfortunately, it was booked for me , for work. I have traveled throughout Mexico many times and this is the worst place I have ever stayed. The best thing was the room maids who were prompt, efficient, and caring. Not too bad was room service, used it twice. Food cam quickly but not approaching hot.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kirk_Franklin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, with good access to the Metro, Metro-bus and taxis. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping options nearby. Outside of peak hour, the taxi ride to or from the airport takes 30 mins - add an hour with peak hour traffic. The meeting/conference rooms on the 8th floor have great views of the surrounding mountains and the city. The hotel restaurant has a good breakfast service. The hotel and restaurant staff are friendly and courteous. If you don't speak Spanish a few of the staff do.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time”
Reviews.Author: atriportwo
Reviews.Content: After 3 visits, our experience suggests we look for a different hotel on our next trip. No wash-cloths, no hand lotion, no coffee pot in the rooms. As there is no "Do Not Disturb" sign in the room, the maid knocked on the door prior to 8 in the morning, each morning we were there - my goodness- we're on vacation! The first night I cut my finger on a sharp object in my suitcase, I went down to the desk to see if they had a first-aid kit with a band-aid. No, no first-aid kit, no band-aid. They sent me (66 y.o. female) out on the street after 10PM to buy a band-aid. This did not seem like a smart way to treat guests in any large city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: JoeMemphis_TNUSA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Hotel Benidorm two times in the last three months. You get a safe, clean, VERY convenient Hotel close to the subway, two shopping malls(one, the Parque Delta matches most anything in the States), and good restaurants within walking distance. If you strictly want to be downtown, there are other good options but the Benidorm is a very short walk from the General Hospital subway stop and just a couple of stops to the Juarez station and many downtown sites--for two pesos--about 15 cents US. One notable feature of the Benidorm is that beds and pillows and bathrooms are top American quality--clean and comfortable. A Large in room safe helps too. For discount prices like on 1800hotels.com I do not see how you can beat the value of the Benidorm. There are great places to eat breakfast nearby--ie the Sanborn's directly across the street. The one totally confusing factor and the only reason I rated service lower is the PRE-purchase breakfast you can buy with the room. Be prepared for an adventure of what the breakfast allows and what you may be charged extra for. Not exorbitant extra charges but irritating and the front desk and restaurant do not seem to communicate-ie dont bother complaining to the mgmt about the confusion of what a pre-purchased breakfast includes. This is a small complaint. Just buy your breakfast separately each day or go to Sanborn's--and stay on the quieter NON-main street back of the hotel, You will be truly amazed what 50 or so USD's buys you!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: erickMedellin
Reviews.Content: Nice location one the most important thing in Mexico DF is a place close to a subway (metro) because the chaotic traffic, this one is close to a one of those stations, and it is 7 blocks from a big mall. Good service at the front desk, clean rooms, a little noise because it is on a heavy traffic street.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel (again and again)”
Reviews.Author: ramgad
Reviews.Content: We promised to return, and we did! This hotel continues to be Five Star to us, we are demanding passengers and frugal, don't like to pay Five Star rates. The front desk clerk remembered us! Service was great, breakfast was excellent, room was large and very clean. This time we met people from Australia and Japan. Again, we were the only Gringos in the house. You will not be disapointed in this hotel and the excellent location. The city's parks are just around the corner. We felt safe with the taxi drivers provided by the hotel. Are we returning, you bet your cowboy boots we are!

Reviews.Title: “Never a 5 star hotel (even 4* !)”
Reviews.Author: PedroMelo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the calla frontera, which means border in spanish, and it is really situated in the border of a decadent residencial neighborhood and a dangerous neighborhood. ItÂ´s a 8 floor building, with recent renovation in the inside and outside. They have a small lobby with a friendly staff. they have a lobby bar that was closed all the time, and without a explanation the guests donÂ´t have any place to sitdown in the hotel (only the stairs...). The room are spacious and fairly clean, however the bed sheets were terrible used (i found a hole in one). The bathroom is far froom a 5 * hotel (more like a 3*). They have a gym thats a joke, small space with most of the equipment were broken... The breakfast was another joke, a nice room with plenty of light, but no cheese or ham !!! the orange juice was in the balcony on the staff area, only one type of bread, however they had fried liver with onions for breakfast... (please!). This should be a decent 3* hotel, but it is not a 5* hotel, even in Mexico city in went/passed in other 5* hotel (4seasons, sheraton, melia - all located in a Avenida da Reforma- very nice neighborhood ), and the diference was huge.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: good place, good price, good service, nice rooms. we payed much more for other hotels in mexico city and mexico and got less.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Benidorm
HotelInfo.Address: Frontera # 217, Col. Roma, Mexico City 06700, Mexico
